{{also|老窦}}
==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=老窦}}

===Etymology===
From {{zh-l|老頭|lou5 tau4}}, possibly due to dialectal ({{w|Shunde}}) influence. The choice of using {{zh-l|*竇}} may be influenced by the connection with Dou Yujun ({{w2|zh|竇禹鈞}}), father of five sons, who had the right method of teaching them.
